intro: Clidemia cutucuensis, commonly known as the cutucuensis mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in association with other epiphytic plants. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
